009
010package imagingbook.common.regions;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D.N4;
013
014import java.util.Arrays;
015import java.util.Collections;
016import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.Map;
019
020import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
022
023/**
024 * <p>
025 * Performs region segmentation on a given binary image. See Ch. 8 of [1] for
026 * additional details. This class is abstract, since the implementation depends
027 * on the concrete region segmentation algorithm being used. Concrete
028 * implementations (subclasses of this class) are
029 * {@link BreadthFirstSegmentation}, {@link DepthFirstSegmentation},
030 * {@link RecursiveSegmentation}, {@link SequentialSegmentation},
031 * {@link RegionContourSegmentation}. Most of the work is done by the
032 * constructor(s). If the segmentation has failed for some reason
033 * {@link #getRegions()} returns {@code null}.
034 * </p>
035 * <p>
036 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
037 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
038 * </p>
039 * 
040 * @author WB
041 * @version 2021/12/22
042 */
043public abstract class BinaryRegionSegmentation {
044        
045        /** The default neighborhood type. */
046        public static final NeighborhoodType2D DefaultNeighborhoodT = N4;
047        
048        static final int Background = 0;
049        static final int Foreground = 1;
050        
051//      final ImageProcessor ip;
052        final int width;
053        final int height;       
054        final NeighborhoodType2D NT;
055        
056        final int[][] labelArray;
057        // label values in labelArray can be:
058        //  0 ... unlabeled
059        // -1 ... previously visited background pixel
060        // >0 ... valid label
061        
062        private final Map<Integer, SegmentationBackedRegion> regions;
063        private final boolean isSegmented;
064        
065        private final int minLabel = 2;
066        private int currentLabel = -1;  // the maximum label assigned sofar
067        private int maxLabel = -1;              // the maximum label assigned total
068        
069        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
070        
071        BinaryRegionSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType2D nh) {
072//              this.ip = ip;
073                this.NT = nh;
074                this.width  = ip.getWidth();
075                this.height = ip.getHeight();
076                this.labelArray = makeLabelArray(ip);
077                this.isSegmented = applySegmentation(ip);
078                this.regions = (isSegmented) ? collectRegions() : Collections.emptyMap();
079        }
080        
081        int[][] makeLabelArray(ByteProcessor ip) {
082                int[][] lA = new int[width][height];    // label array
083                // set all pixels to either FOREGROUND or BACKGROUND (by thresholding)
084                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
085                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
086                                lA[u][v] = (ip.get(u, v) != 0) ? Foreground : Background;
087                        }
088                }
089                return lA;
090        }
091        
092        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
093        
094        /**
095         * This method must be implemented by all concrete sub-classes.
096         * @param ip TODO
097         * 
098         * @return true if segmentation was successful
099         */
100        abstract boolean applySegmentation(ByteProcessor ip);
101        
102        /**
103         * Returns the width of the segmented image. 
104         * @return the width of the segmented image
105         */
106        public int getWidth() {
107                return this.width;
108        }
109        
110        /**
111         * Returns the height of the segmented image. 
112         * @return the height of the segmented image
113         */
114        public int getHeight() {
115                return this.height;
116        }
117        
118        /**
119         * Returns the minimum label assigned by this segmentation.
120         * @return the minimum label
121         */
122        public int getMinLabel() {
123                return minLabel;
124        }
125        
126        /**
127         * Returns the maximum label assigned by this segmentation.
128         * @return the maximum label
129         */
130        public int getMaxLabel() {
131                return maxLabel;
132        }
133        
134        /**
135         * Returns true if the segmentation did complete successfully,
136         * false otherwise.
137         * 
138         * @return true if segmentation was successful
139         */
140        public boolean isSegmented() {
141                return isSegmented;
142        }
143        
144        /**
145         * Returns an unsorted list of all regions associated with this region labeling.
146         * The returned list is empty if no regions were detected.
147         * See also {@link #getRegions(boolean)}.
148         * 
149         * @return a (possibly empty) list of detected regions
150         */
151        public List<BinaryRegion> getRegions() {
152                return getRegions(false);       // unsorted
153        }
154        
155        /**
156         * Returns a (optionally sorted) list of all regions associated with this region labeling.
157         * The returned list is empty if no regions were detected.
158         * 
159         * @param sort set {@code true} to sort regions by size (largest regions first).
160         * @return the list of detected regions or {@code null} if the segmentation has failed.
161         */
162        public List<BinaryRegion> getRegions(boolean sort) {
163                if (regions == null) {
164                        throw new RuntimeException("regions is null, this should never happen");
165                }
166                BinaryRegion[] ra = regions.values().toArray(new BinaryRegion[0]);
167                if (sort) {
168                        Arrays.sort(ra);
169                }
170                return Arrays.asList(ra);
171        }
172        
173        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
174        
175        /**
176         * Creates a (map) container of {@link BinaryRegion} objects,
177         * collects the region pixels from the label image
178         * and calls {@link SegmentationBackedRegion#update()} to compute
179         * the statistics for each region.
180         * Region label numbers serve as map keys.
181         * @return a map of {@link BinaryRegion} instances.
182         */
183        Map<Integer, SegmentationBackedRegion> collectRegions() {
184                SegmentationBackedRegion[] regionArray = new SegmentationBackedRegion[maxLabel + 1];
185                for (int label = minLabel; label <= maxLabel; label++) {
186                        regionArray[label] = new SegmentationBackedRegion(label, this);
187                }
188                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
189                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
190                                int label = getLabel(u, v);
191                                if (label >= minLabel && label <= maxLabel && regionArray[label] != null) {
192                                        regionArray[label].addPixel(u, v);
193                                }
194                        }
195                }
196                // create a list of regions to return, collect nonempty regions
197                Map<Integer, SegmentationBackedRegion> regionMap = new LinkedHashMap<>();
198                for (SegmentationBackedRegion r: regionArray) {
199                        if (r != null && r.getSize() > 0) {
200                                r.update();     // compute the statistics for this region
201                                regionMap.put(r.getLabel(), r); //add(r);
202                        }
203                }
204                return regionMap;
205        }
206        
207        /**
208         * Returns the label number for the specified image coordinate.
209         * -1 is returned for out-of-image coordinates.
210         * 
211         * @param u the horizontal coordinate.
212         * @param v the vertical coordinate.
213         * @return the label number for the given position or -1 if outside the image
214         */
215        public int getLabel(int u, int v) {
216                return (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height) ? labelArray[u][v] : -1;
217        }
218        
219        void setLabel(int u, int v, int label) {
220                if (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height)
221                        labelArray[u][v] = label;
222        }
223        
224        int getNextLabel() {
225                currentLabel = (currentLabel < 1) ? minLabel : currentLabel + 1;
226                maxLabel = currentLabel;
227                return currentLabel;
228        }
229        
230        boolean isRegionLabel(int i) {
231                return (i >= minLabel);
232        }
233
234        // --------------------------------------------------
235
236        /**
237         * Finds the region associated to the specified label
238         * or {@code null} if no region for that label exists.
239         * 
240         * @param label the region's label number
241         * @return the region object associated with the given label
242         *              or {@code null} if it does not exist
243         */
244        public SegmentationBackedRegion getRegion(int label) {
245                return (label < minLabel || label > maxLabel) ? null : regions.get(label);
246        }
247        
248        /**
249         * Returns the {@link BinaryRegion} instance associated with
250         * the given image position or {@code null} if the segmentation
251         * contains no region covering the given position.
252         * 
253         * @param u the horizontal position.
254         * @param v the vertical position.
255         * @return The associated {@link BinaryRegion} object or {@code null} if
256         *              this {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation} has no region at the given position.
257         */
258        public SegmentationBackedRegion getRegion(int u, int v) {
259                return getRegion(getLabel(u, v));
260        }
261
262}
